overview.title: Your Funds
overview.metric-1-tooltip: KSU balance currently held in your Web3 wallet, including the current estimated USDC equivalent.
overview.metric-2-tooltip: Total USDC equivalent value of all tokens in your Web3 wallet that can be used to purchase KSU tokens.
overview.metric-3-tooltip: Your balance of KSU currently locked.

rksuBalance.tooltip: The value of your current rKSU balance, which is derived by a multiplier applied to your amount of locked KSU. This multiplier varies according to your locking period, per the below table. The value of your rKSU balance relative to your total current and pending USDC deposits across all Lending Strategies determines your Loyalty Level. Your Loyalty Level determines the extent of your token utility (lending strategy deposit priority and withdrawal priority) and associated rewards (APY bonus). Regardless of your Loyalty Level, your rKSU balance relative to the total rKSU in the Kasu ecosystem, also determines your share of Protocol Fees.

loyalty.title: Loyalty Status
loyalty.metric-1-tooltip: The value of your current rKSU balance, which is derived by a multiplier applied to your amount of locked KSU. This multiplier varies according to your locking period, per the below table. The value of your rKSU balance relative to your total current and pending USDC deposits across all Lending Strategies determines your Loyalty Level. Your Loyalty Level determines the extent of your token utility (lending strategy deposit priority and withdrawal priority) and associated rewards (APY bonus). Regardless of your Loyalty Level, your rKSU balance relative to the total rKSU in the Kasu ecosystem, also determines your share of Protocol Fees.
loyalty.metric-2-toolip: For the purposes of calculating your Loyalty Level, your total lending includes your existing lending plus your pending lending.
loyalty.metric-3: rKSU to Total USDC Lending Ratio

metric-3-toolip.description: The value of your rKSU balance relative to your total current and pending USDC deposits across all Lending Strategies. This ratio determines your Loyalty Level. Your Loyalty Level determines the extent of your token utility (lending strategy deposit priority access and withdrawal priority) and associated rewards (APY bonus) as follows:
metric-3-toolip.subtitle-1-description: If the value of your rKSU balance relative to your current and pending USDC deposits is less than 1%, then:
metric-3-toolip.subtitle-1-list-0: No withdrawal or deposit priority benefits apply.
metric-3-toolip.subtitle-1-list-1: Deposit/withdrawal requests are processed after Loyalty level 1 and 2 Token Lockers.
metric-3-toolip.subtitle-2-description: If the value of your rKSU balance relative to your total current and pending USDC deposits across all Lending Strategies is 1% or greater, but less than 5%, you will achieve Loyalty Level 1, entitling you to the following privileges:
metric-3-toolip.subtitle-2-list-0: Second order priority access to lending strategies (behind Loyalty Level 2).
metric-3-toolip.subtitle-2-list-1: Second order priority for capital withdrawals from lending strategies (behind Loyalty Level 2).
metric-3-toolip.subtitle-2-list-2: Additional APY (APY Bonus) from your deposits in all lending strategies, awarded in KSU (subject to change according to liquidity demand and supply requirements).
metric-3-toolip.subtitle-3-description: If the value of your rKSU balance relative to your total current and pending USDC deposits across all Lending Strategies is 5% or greater, you will achieve Loyalty Level 2, entitling you to the following privileges:
metric-3-toolip.subtitle-3-list-0: First order priority access to lending strategies.
metric-3-toolip.subtitle-3-list-1: Firstly order priority for capital withdrawals from lending strategies.
metric-3-toolip.subtitle-3-list-2: Additional APY (more APY Bonus than Loyalty Level 1 Token Lockers) from your deposits in all lending strategies, awarded in KSU (subject to change according to liquidity demand and supply requirements).

level-0.title: No Loyalty Status
level-0.subtitle: If the value of your rKSU balance relative to your current and pending USDC lending is less than 1%:

list.list-0: No priority access to Lending Strategies and loan Tranches, where you will be subject to the normal queuing system after Loyalty Level 1 and 2 Token Lockers.
list.list-1: No priority for capital withdrawals from your existing lending, where you will be subject to the normal queuing system after Loyalty Level 1 and 2 Token Lockers.
list.list-2: No additional APY (APY Bonus), excluding you from any bonus interest earnings on your lending.

level-1.title: Loyalty Level 1
level-1.subtitle: If the value of your rKSU balance relative to your total current and pending USDC lending across all Lending Strategies is 1% or greater, but less than 5%, you will achieve Loyalty Level 1, entitling you to the following token utility and benefits:

list.list-0: Second order priority access to Lending Strategies and loan Tranches (behind Loyalty Level 2).
list.list-1: Second order priority for capital withdrawals from your existing lending (behind Loyalty Level 2).
list.list-2: Additional APY (APY Bonus) awarding you with bonus interest earnings on all your lending, awarded in KSU (subject to change according to liquidity demand and supply requirements).

level-2.title: Loyalty Level 2
level-2.subtitle: If the value of your rKSU balance relative to your total current and pending USDC lending across all Lending Strategies is 5% or greater, you will achieve Loyalty Level 2, entitling you to the following token utility and benefits:

list.list-0: First order priority access to Lending Strategies and loan Tranches.
list.list-1: First order priority for capital withdrawals from your existing lending.
list.list-2: Additional APY (more APY Bonus than Loyalty Level 1 Token Lockers) awarding you with bonus interest earnings on all your lending, awarded in KSU (subject to change according to liquidity demand and supply requirements).

rewardsSummary.title: Bonus & Rewards Summary
rewardsSummary.metric-1-tooltip: Your share of USDC Protocol Fees earned that is available to claim. A Token Locker must also participate in USDC lending and generate rKSU to be eligible for Protocol Fee Sharing. Token Lockers, who are also Lenders generating rKSU, are entitled to a share of 5% of the total gross interest earnings generated by lending activities on Kasu. Your proportionate share of this amount is determined by your rKSU balance relative to the total combined rKSU balances generated by all Lenders in the Kasu ecosystem. For example, in a scenario where a total of 1,000 rKSU from Lenders exists in the entire Kasu ecosystem, a Lender with a current balance of 150 rKSU (which is 15%) would be entitled to 15% of all Protocol Fees. This proportionality is augmented as more Lenders lock (or unlock) KSU to generate more rKSU (or burn more rKSU when unlocking), entitling them to a proportionate share of Protocol Fees.
rewardsSummary.metric-2-toolip: The value of your KSU balance (and estimated USDC equivalent value) associated with the following bonuses/rewards (per Rewards 1 and 2 below): 1) APY Bonus (only applicable to Loyalty Level 1 and 2 KSU Token Lockers); and, 2) KSU Launch Bonus (only applicable for early Token Lockers until the KSU bonus pool (5% of total supply) is fully consumed, which is based on the amount and duration of KSU locked and the associated multiplier).

rewards-1.title: Reward 1 • APY Bonus
rewards-1.subtitle: (Paid in KSU)
rewards-1.metric-1: APY Bonus Based on Loyalty Level
rewards-1.metric-1-tooltip: Your APY bonus (paid in KSU) in addition to the APY associated with your current USDC lending balances, which is only applicable to Loyalty Level 1 and 2 KSU Token Lockers. Loyalty Level 2 Token Lockers receive a higher APY bonus than Loyalty Level 1. The APY bonus is variable and will change from time to time to meet liquidity demand and supply requirements.
rewards-1.metric-2-tooltip: The balance of your APY bonus interest earnings that is available to claim.
rewards-1.metric-3-tooltip: The total amount of APY bonus interest your have received since the very first time you achieved (and maintained) Loyalty Level 1 or 2.

rewards-2.title: Reward 2 • KSU Launch Bonus
rewards-2.metric-tooltip: Your total KSU Launch Bonus received for being an early Token Locker, based on the amount and duration of KSU locked and the associated multiplier as follows:

rewards-3.title: Reward 3 • Protocol Fee Sharing
rewards-3.metric-1-tooltip: Your current balance of USDC Protocol Fees earned. A Token Locker must also participate in USDC lending and generate rKSU to be eligible for Protocol Fee Sharing. Token Lockers, who are also Lenders generating rKSU, are entitled to a share of 5% of the total gross interest earnings generated by lending activities on Kasu. Your proportionate share of this amount is determined by your rKSU balance relative to the total combined rKSU balance of all Lenders in the Kasu ecosystem. For example, in a scenario where a total of 1,000 rKSU from Lenders exists in the entire Kasu ecosystem, a Lender with a current balance of 150 rKSU (which is 15%) would be entitled to 15% of all Protocol Fees. This proportionality is augmented as more Lenders lock (or unlock) KSU to generate more rKSU (or burn more rKSU when unlocking), entitling them to a proportionate share of Protocol Fees.
rewards-3.metric-2-tooltip: Your share of USDC Protocol Fees earned (claimed and unclaimed) since you very first started generating rKSU as a Lender and Token Locker. A Token Locker must also participate in USDC lending and generate rKSU to be eligible for Protocol Fee Sharing. Token Lockers, who are also Lenders generating rKSU, are entitled to a share of 5% of the total gross interest earnings generated by lending activities on Kasu. Your proportionate share of this amount is determined by your rKSU balance relative to the total combined rKSU balance of all Lenders in the Kasu ecosystem. For example, in a scenario where a total of 1,000 rKSU from Lenders exists in the entire Kasu ecosystem, a Lender with a current balance of 150 rKSU (which is 15%) would be entitled to 15% of all Protocol Fees. This proportionality is augmented as more Lenders lock (or unlock) KSU to generate more rKSU (or burn more rKSU when unlocking), entitling them to a proportionate share of Protocol Fees.

loyaltyLevels.title: Loyalty levels
loyaltyLevels.subtitle: About KSU Loyalty Program
loyaltyLevels.description-1: The more KSU you lock, the higher your Loyalty Level and the more token utility and rewards you receive.
loyaltyLevels.description-2: If you do not wish to lock KSU tokens, then you can still participate in lending to earn interest. However, you will not receive any APY Bonus, and your Lending and Withdrawal Requests will be prioritised behind Loyalty Level 1 and 2 Token Lockers.
loyaltyLevels.description-3: Each KSU token that you unlock will burn a proportionate amount of rKSU, which may adversely impact your rKSU to Total USDC Lending Ratio. In order to maintain your Loyalty Level and associated utility and rewards, be sure to maintain an amount of locked KSU to avoid burning rKSU to the point that it falls below the minimum required ratio (for each Loyalty Level) outlined above.

termsAndConditions.title: Lending Terms and Conditions
termsAndConditions.subtitle: By submitting this lending request, you acknowledge and agree to the following Terms and Conditions. It is important to read and understand these terms, as they outline the rights, responsibilities, and risks associated with your participation in the Kasu protocol.

subheader-1.title: Risk Disclosure: Senior, Mezzanine and Junior Tranches.
subheader-1.description: When lending through Kasu, it is essential to understand the different types of lending tranches—Senior, Mezzanine, and Junior—and the associated risks. Each tranche has a distinct risk profile and position in the capital structure, which affects the potential returns and the likelihood of recovering the loaned capital.
subheader-1.subtitle: Acknowledgment of Risks
subheader-1.subtitle-description: By lending in a particular tranche, Lenders acknowledge and accept the inherent risks associated with their chosen position in terms of priority in the event of losses. It is crucial for Lenders to thoroughly assess their risk tolerance, lending objectives, and financial situation before committing capital to any tranche.

sub-subheader-1.title: Senior Tranche
sub-subheader-1.description: The Senior Tranche is the highest-ranking tranche. In the event of losses, Senior Tranche Lenders have the first claim on any recovered funds.

list-0.title: Lower Yield:
list-0.description: Due to its priority in repayment in the event of losses, the Senior Tranche typically offers lower interest rates compared to Mezzanine and Junior tranches.

list-1.title: Credit Risk:
list-1.description: In the event of the end borrower's default, Senior Tranche lenders are paid first from any recovered funds, but this still depends on the overall recovery rate.

sub-subheader-2.title: Mezzanine Tranche
sub-subheader-2.description: The Mezzanine Tranche sits between the Senior and Junior tranches. It generally offers higher returns than the Senior Tranche but comes with increased risk.

list-0.title: Subordination Risk in Event of Losses:
list-0.description: Mezzanine lenders are subordinated to Senior Tranche lenders in the event of losses, meaning they are repaid only after all Senior Tranche obligations have been met.

list-1.title: Credit Risk:
list-1.description: There is a higher risk of non-payment compared to the Senior Tranche. In a default scenario, Mezzanine lenders may experience significant delays in repayment or potentially incur losses.

sub-subheader-3.title: Junior Tranche
sub-subheader-3.description: The Junior Tranche is the lowest-ranking tranche. It offers the highest potential returns but also bears the greatest risk.

list-0.title: Subordination Risk in Event of Losses:
list-0.description: Junior Tranche lenders are the last to be paid in the event of losses. They only receive repayments after all Senior and Mezzanine obligations have been fulfilled.

list-1.title: Credit Risk:
list-1.description: The risk of loss is highest in the Junior Tranche. In a worst-case scenario, Junior lenders may lose their entire capital if the recovered funds are insufficient to cover higher-ranking debts.

subheader-2.title: Fees Explanation and Gross APY Disclosure
subheader-2.description-2: All advertised APY rates are presented on a
subheader-2.description-4: . This means that the actual APY received by Lenders will be net of the protocol fees outlined below.
subheader-2.description-6: All fees taken by the Kasu protocol are derived from the interest generated by lending activities. A percentage of this interest is allocated to various components of the ecosystem to support its ongoing development and maintenance.
subheader-2.description-8: For example, if a Lending Strategy offers an advertised 20% APY to Lenders, the associated fees are as follows:
subheader-2.description-9: In this scenario, a Lender who participates in a Lending Strategy advertised with a 20% APY (gross) will receive 18% APY (net) after the deduction of fees.

list-0.title: Protocol Fee Sharing:
list-0.description: 5% of the total interest earned by Lenders is allocated towards Protocol Fee Sharing.

list-1.title: Kasu Protocol Wallet:
list-1.description: 5% of the total interest earned by Lenders is allocated to the Kasu Protocol wallet.

list-2.list-0: 1% APY (5% of 20% APY) is allocated towards Protocol Fee Sharing.
list-2.list-1: 1% APY (5% of 20% APY) goes to the Kasu Protocol wallet.

subheader-3.title: Interest Accrual
subheader-3.description: Interest on loaned capital is accrued on a per epoch basis and added to each Lender's loan balance. Accordingly, accessing accrued interest occurs through the same mechanisms as accessing the initial loaned capital, requiring a withdrawal request.
subheader-3.subtitle: Acknowledgment of Interest Accrual Process
subheader-3.subtitle-description: By lending through Kasu, Lenders acknowledge and accept the interest accrual process. It is essential for Lenders to understand that interest is accrued on a per epoch basis and reflected in their loan balance. Access to these funds requires a withdrawal request, which applies to both the initial loaned capital and the accrued interest.

subheader-4.title: Pending Phase Before Interest Accrual
subheader-4.description: When Lenders submit a Lending Request to Kasu, their funds enter a Pending Phase until the next Clearing Period. The Clearing Period occurs at the end of an epoch, during which Lending Requests and Loan Withdrawal Requests are processed.
subheader-4.subtitle: Acknowledgment of Pending Phase and Clearing Period Process
subheader-4.subtitle-description: By lending through Kasu, Lenders acknowledge and accept the Pending Phase and Clearing Period process. It is crucial for Lenders to understand that their funds will only start accruing interest once their Lending Request is accepted at the end of the Clearing Period. Lenders also acknowledge that in rare circumstances, a Clearing Period could be missed, resulting in their Lending Request being processed in a future epoch.

list-0.title: Pending Phase:
list-0.description: Funds do not start accruing interest immediately upon the submission of a Lending Request. They remain in a Pending Phase until the next Clearing Period.

list-1.title: Clearing Period:
list-1.description: At the end of each epoch, during the Clearing Period, Lending Requests and Loan Withdrawal Requests are processed. Based on factors such as each Lender's Loyalty Level and the liquidity needs of each Lending Strategy, funds are either accepted or rejected.

list-2.title: Start of Interest Accrual:
list-2.description: If funds from a Lending Request are accepted at the end of the epoch, the Lender will then start accruing interest from the beginning of the next epoch.

list-3.title: Clearing Period Delays:
list-3.description: In rare instances, a Clearing Period could be missed, causing the Lending Request to be processed at a future epoch.

subheader-5.title: Loan Withdrawal Requests
subheader-5.description: When Lenders submit a Loan Withdrawal Request to Kasu, their request enters a Pending Hhase. The processing of these requests is contingent upon the excess liquidity within the specific Lending Strategy and may therefore remain outstanding (or partially outstanding) for more than one epoch.
subheader-5.subtitle: Acknowledgment of Loan Withdrawal Request Process
subheader-5.subtitle-description: By submitting a Loan Withdrawal Request through Kasu, Lenders acknowledge and accept the Pending Phase and the process based on excess liquidity. Lenders understand that:

list-0.title: Pending Phase and Excess Liquidity:
list-0.description: Loan Withdrawal Requests are processed based on the excess funds available within the given Lending Strategy at the time of submission. This means that Lenders may only withdraw funds up to the excess liquidity available, potentially resulting in partially fulfilled (or even unfulfilled Withdrawal Requests.

list-1.title: Multiple Epochs:
list-1.description: Requests may therefore remain outstanding (or partially outstanding) for more than one epoch until sufficient liquidity is available.

list-2.title: Priority Based on Loyalty Level:
list-2.description: Withdrawal Requests are prioritised according to each Lender's Loyalty Level, with higher Loyalty Levels receiving preference. Lenders with lower or no Loyalty Levels may experience longer waiting times for their Withdrawal Requests to be processed.

list-3.title: Automatic Loyalty Level Increase:
list-3.description: Any Withdrawal Request left outstanding for more than five epochs will automatically receive the highest Loyalty Level status until the withdrawal is processed.

list-4.title: Interest Accrual:
list-4.description: Interest continues to accrue during the Pending Phase until the Withdrawal Request is processed. Upon the successful processing of a Withdrawal Request, the withdrawing Lender's lending position stops accruing interest.

list-1.list-0: Access to their funds is contingent upon the availability of excess liquidity within the Lending Strategy.
list-1.list-1: Withdrawal Requests are prioritised based on Loyalty Level, potentially resulting in longer waiting times for lower or no Loyalty Level Lenders.
list-1.list-2: Withdrawal Requests may therefore remain outstanding (or partially outstanding) for more than one epoch until sufficient liquidity is available.
list-1.list-3: Any outstanding Withdrawal Request for more than five epochs will automatically receive the highest Loyalty Level until the withdrawal is processed.
list-1.list-4: Interest continues to accrue during the Pending Phase and stops only upon the successful processing of a Withdrawal Request.

subheader-6.title: Tranche Allocation and Overflow in Case of Oversubscription
subheader-6.description: When Lenders submit a Lending Request for a specific tranche through Kasu, it’s possible that the requested tranche could be oversubscribed. In such cases, the following process is applied:
subheader-6.description-1: An example is given by the following Lending Strategy with three tranches:
subheader-6.description-2: In this scenario, the excess 50,000 USDC from the Junior tranche will be reallocated to the Mezzanine tranche. Once the Mezzanine tranche is filled, the remaining 40,000 USDC will be reallocated to the Senior tranche. This results in:
subheader-6.description-3: This scenario leaves 30,000 USDC of the initial requests unallocated, which will be returned to the Lenders who submitted those requests.
subheader-6.subtitle: Acknowledgment of Tranche Allocation and Overflow Process
subheader-6.subtitle-description: By lending through Kasu, Lenders acknowledge and accept the tranche allocation and overflow process in case of oversubscription. Lenders understand that:

list-0.title: Oversubscription Handling:
list-0.description: If a requested tranche (e.g., Junior) is oversubscribed, the excess funds are automatically reallocated to the next available tranche with capacity (e.g., Mezzanine or Senior).

list-1.title: Continual Reallocation:
list-1.description: This reallocation continues down the line until all available tranches are filled.

list-2.title: No Opt-Out:
list-2.description: Lenders cannot opt-out of this reallocation process once their Lending Request is submitted. If they do not wish to participate in a lower-yielding tranche, they must submit a Loan Withdrawal Request as outlined earlier.

list-3.title: Potential Return of Funds:
list-3.description: If the reallocation process reaches the Senior tranche and it is still oversubscribed, any remaining unallocated funds will be returned to the Lenders who submitted those requests.

list-0.title: Priority Allocation:
list-0.description: Higher Loyalty Levels increase the likelihood of allocation to the desired tranche but do not guarantee it.

list-3.list-0: Their Lending Requests may be reallocated to lower-yielding tranches if the requested tranche is oversubscribed.
list-3.list-1: Higher Loyalty Levels increase but do not guarantee priority allocation to the desired tranche.
list-3.list-2: Reallocation is automated. If Lenders do not wish to accept a lower-yielding tranche, they must submit a Loan Withdrawal Request.
list-3.list-3: Any unallocated funds at the end of the reallocation process will be returned to the Lenders if the Senior tranche is still oversubscribed.

reviewLock.unlockingSchedule: Unlocking request will be scheduled to the end of the current Epoch.
reviewLock.metric-2-tooltip: The amount of KSU you request to unlock at the end of the current locking period.

overview.metric-1-tooltip: Amount of KSU you are requesting to unlock.
overview.metric-2-tooltip: The amount of rKSU derived from the multiplier applied to your amount of locked KSU, which varies according to your locking period. rKSU will be burned in relative proportion to the amount of KSU you have requested to unlock. If you are also a Lender, this may adversely affect your Loyalty Level, which in turn, adversely affects your access and withdrawal priority to and from loans, along with your APY bonus. It will also reduce your share of Protocol Fees, regardless of Loyalty Level. The value of your rKSU balance relative to your total current and pending USDC lending across all Lending Strategies determines your Loyalty Level. Your Loyalty Level determines the extent of your token utility (lending access priority and lending withdrawal priority to and from Lending Strategies) and associated rewards (APY bonus). Regardless of your Loyalty Level, your rKSU balance, relative to the total combined rKSU balance of all Lenders in the Kasu ecosystem, also determines your share of Protocol Fees.
overview.metric-3-tooltip: The start date you locked this particular amount of KSU.

withdraw.withdraw-metric-1-tooltip: The amount of KSU you will have have left after processing your KSU unlock request.
withdraw.withdraw-metric-2-tooltip: The amount of rKSU you will have have left after processing your KSU unlock request. rKSU will be burned in relative proportion to the amount of KSU that will be unlocked, which may adversely affect your Loyalty Level and associated token utility and benefits.
withdraw.withdraw-metric-3-tooltip: The amount of KSU you request to unlock at the end of the current locking period.

completed.description-2: to be unlocked in the next Epoch
completed.description-5: to be withdrawn to the wallet

lending.title: Lending Request
lending.terms-and-conditions-1: By depositing funds to this Lending Strategy, you accept the

deposit.amount-metric-1: Minimum KSU Lock Amount for Loyalty 1
deposit.amount-metric-2: Minimum KSU Lock Amount for Loyalty 2

description.metric-1: By depositing funds to this Lending Strategy, you accept the following
description.metric-4: IF THIS TRANCHE IS OVERSUBSCRIBED, YOU WILL BE AUTOMATICALLY REALLOCATED TO THE NEXT AVAILABLE TRANCHE WITH A LOWER APY WITHOUT THE OPPORTUNITY TO OPT OUT. YOU WILL THEN BE SUBJECT TO QUEUING SYSTEM SHOULD YOU WISH TO WITHDRAW YOUR FUNDS.
description.metric-5: YOU WILL BE SUBJECT TO A QUEUING SYSTEM SHOULD YOU WISH TO WITHDRAW YOUR FUNDS FROM ANY TRANCHE. YOU CAN ACHIEVE WITHDRAWAL PRIORITY IN THE QUEUE BY LOCKING KSU TO ESTABLISH /INCREASE YOUR LOYALTY LEVEL​.
description.metric-6: How do I secure my spot in this tranche?
description.metric-7: Access to higher APY tranches is based on Loyalty Level. In the event of oversubscription, applicants will be automatically reassigned to the next available tranche. This process repeats for each tranche. Higher Loyalty Levels increase the likelihood of allocation to the desired tranche, but do not guarantee it.

duration.title: Locking Duration
duration.unlocking-date: The date that your locked KSU will become unlocked, based on the locking duration simulation your have chosen via the above slider.

estimates.title: Estimates
estimates.tooltip-1: Your projected USDC Protocol Fees. This is based on your simulated KSU locking amount and duration, and the project amount of rKSU this is expected to be generated per the rKSU multiplier displayed in the above slider. A Token Locker must also participate in USDC lending and generate rKSU to be eligible for Protocol Fee Sharing. Token Lockers, who are also Lenders generating rKSU, are entitled to a share of 5% of the total gross interest earnings generated by lending activities on Kasu. Your proportionate share of this amount is determined by your rKSU balance relative to the total combined rKSU balance of all Lenders in the Kasu ecosystem. For example, in a scenario where a total of 1,000 rKSU from Lenders exists in the entire Kasu ecosystem, a Lender with a current balance of 150 rKSU (which is 15%) would be entitled to 15% of all Protocol Fees. This proportionality is augmented as more Lenders lock (or unlock) KSU to generate more rKSU (or burn more rKSU when unlocking), entitling them to a proportionate share of Protocol Fees.
estimates.tooltip-2: Your projected APY bonus interest (paid in KSU) in addition to the APY associated with your lending balances, which is only applicable to Loyalty Level 1 and 2 KSU Token Lockers. Loyalty Level 2 Token Lockers receive a higher APY bonus than Loyalty Level 1. The APY bonus is variable and will change from time to meet liquidity demand and supply requirements.
estimates.tooltip-3: Your projected KSU Launch Bonus for being an early Token Locker, based on the amount and duration of KSU locked and the associated multiplier as follows:

reviewLock.lockAmount-tooltip: The amount of KSU you are requesting to lock.
reviewLock.lockingDuration-tooltip: The number of days you are requesting your KSU to be locked for.
reviewLock.depositSchedule: Locking request will be scheduled to the end of the current Epoch.

earningsCalculator.title: Earnings Calculator
earningsCalculator.subtitle: Simulate your potential interest earnings

simulatedAmount.title: Lending Scenario
simulatedAmount.metric-1: Swap any token to USDC to start lending.

simulatedDuration.title: Simulated Lending Duration
simulatedDuration.description-1: EXAMPLE ONLY • DURATION IS NOT FIXED
simulatedDuration.description-2: YOU CAN REQUEST WITHDRAWAL AT ANY TIME (SUBJECT TO AVAILABLE LIQUIDITY)

simulatedYieldEarnings.title: Simulated Yield Earnings
simulatedYieldEarnings.metric-1-tooltip: The Annual Percentage Yield that will be applied to determine your interest earnings simulation, assuming all repayments will be made as expected. This is based on the APY currently offered by the Delegate and is subject to change during the simulation forecast period.
simulatedYieldEarnings.metric-2-tooltip: Forecast USDC interest earnings (after fees) associated with the lending amount entered and duration selected for this Lending Strategy at the given APY, assuming all repayments will be made as expected.
simulatedYieldEarnings.metric-3-tooltip: The APY bonus (paid in KSU) that will be applied to determine your bonus interest earnings simulation, which is only applicable to Loyalty Level 1 and 2 KSU Token Lockers. Loyalty Level 2 Token Lockers receive a higher APY bonus than Loyalty Level 1. The APY bonus is variable and will change from time to meet liquidity demand and supply requirements.
simulatedYieldEarnings.metric-4-tooltip: Forecast bonus interest earnings based on the APY bonus (for the given Loyalty Level), applied to the lending amount entered and duration selected for this Lending Strategy.

earningsCalculator.slippage-tooltip: Swapping your cryptocurrency to USDC will be executed via 1inch, which may incur slippage of up to 1%. Slippage refers to the difference between the expected price of a trade and the actual executed price of the trade. It typically occurs in markets experiencing high volatility, low liquidity and network congestion. For example, assume you wish buy 50 USDC for 400 DOGE (which is the same as 'swapping' 400 DOGE for 50 USDC). But, due to sudden market volatility, the actual executed price ends up being 404 DOGE. In this case, the slippage is 4 DOGE, or 1% of the intended trade amount. The maximum amount of slippage tolerance for this trade is set at 1%

cancelWithdrawal.title: Cancel Withdrawal Request
cancelWithdrawal.metric-2-tooltip: The USDC lending withdrawal request amount that you would like to cancel.
cancelWithdrawal.metric-3-tooltip: The date of your original lending withdrawal request.
cancelWithdrawal.metric-4-tooltip: The loan Tranche related to this Lending Strategy that you request a withdrawal cancellation from.

cancelDeposit.title: Cancel Lending Request
cancelDeposit.metric-1-tooltip: The Lending Strategy that your lending cancellation request relates to.
cancelDeposit.metric-2-tooltip: The loan Tranche related to this Lending Strategy that you request a lending cancellation from.
cancelDeposit.metric-3-tooltip: The USDC lending request amount that you would like to cancel.
cancelDeposit.metric-4-tooltip: The date of your original lending request.

poolOverview.title: Lending Strategy Overview

apyStructure.label: APY Structure
apyStructure.tooltip: Indicates whether the APY offered by the Delegate to Lenders is fixed for a specified period of time, or variable.​ A variable APY will be subject to change upon each epoch.

fixedApyExpiry.label: Fixed APY Expiry Date
fixedApyExpiry.tooltip: The date that the fixed APY expires and reverts to a Variable APY, or a new fixed APY.

assetClass.label: Asset Class
assetClass.tooltip: The lending specialisation, type or category adopted by the Delegate for this Lending Strategy.

industry.label: Industry Exposure
industry.tooltip: Industry and/or business category in which the Delegate's customers (end borrowers) operate.

security.label: Security
security.tooltip: The form of collateral or commitment provided by the Delegate's customers (end borrowers) to secure their loans, so that in the event of default, the Delegate has recourse to recover the debt.

lendingHistory.label: Lending History
lendingHistory.tooltip: Total length of time the Delegate has been operating as a lending business.

loansUnder.label: Total Active Lending
loansUnder.tooltip: Total USDC equivalent face value of all loans that the Delegate currently has deployed to end borrowers from this Lending Strategy.

tvl.label: Total Value Locked (TVL)
tvl.tooltip: Total USDC funds deployed by Lenders to this Lending Strategy, plus first loss capital (if contributed by the Delegate).

terms.label: Term & Structure
terms.tooltip: The structure of each loan provided by the Delegate to its customers (end borrowers) with regard to maturity date and repayment profile to suit the lending asset class related to this Lending Strategy. A Revolving Loan refers to a loan structure that has no defined end date as it is typically utilised to fund ongoing operations (akin to a Line of Credit, Working Capital Loan or Evergreen Facility). An Amortising loan refers to a loan structure that has defined Principal and Interest repayment periods until it is fully repaid upon a specific end/maturity date, as it is typically utilised to fund core debt, capital expenditure and long term projects.

totalPoolYieldEarnings.label: Total Lending Strategy
totalPoolYieldEarnings.tooltip: Cumulative total gross interest earned by Lenders from this Lending Strategy since its inception on the Kasu protocol.

totalLossRate.label: Total Loss Rate
totalLossRate.tooltip: ​Total unrecoverable losses expressed as a percentage of total loans associated with this Lending Strategy.

remainingCapacity.label: Remaining Capacity
remainingCapacity.tooltip: Amount of additional USDC funds the Delegate can accept within this Lending Strategy, also represented as a percentage of the maximum Lending Strategy target amount.​

investmentCard.title: Your Lending
investmentCard.tooltip: The Annual Percentage Yield currently offered by the Delegate for this Lending Strategy, assuming all repayments will be made as expected.

totalAmount.label: Total Lending Balance
totalAmount.tooltip: Your combined total USDC lending balance across all Tranches (or single Lending Strategy offer in the absence of multiple Tranches) within this Lending Strategy.

weightedAvgApy.label: Weighted Average APY
weightedAvgApy.tooltip: The average gross APY (before fees) you are currently earning within this Lending Strategy that has been adjusted to reflect your weighted contribution to each Tranche relative to your total contribution across all Tranches. In the absence of multiple Tranches, this simply reflects the gross APY for this Lending Strategy (assuming all repayment will be made as expected).​

totYieldEarned.label: Total Lifetime Interest Earned
totYieldEarned.tooltip: The total combined amount of interest you have earned (after fees) from all tranches within this Lending Strategy (or single Lending Strategy offer in the absence of multiple Tranches) since you first started lending to this Lending Strategy. To view a breakdown of your total historical interest earned across all Lending Strategies, please visit the 'My Portfolio' tab.

amountInvested.label: Lending Balance
amountInvested.tooltip: Your current USDC lending balance in this Tranche.

trancheApy.label: Tranche APY
trancheApy.tooltip: The Annual Percentage Yield currently offered by the Delegate for this Tranche of this Lending Strategy, assuming all repayments will be made as expected.

yieldEarned.label: Lifetime Interest Earned
yieldEarned.tooltip: The total amount of interest you have earned (after fees) from this particular loan Tranche since you first started lending to this Tranche. To view a breakdown of your total historical interest earned across all Tranches and Lending Strategies, please visit the 'My Portfolio' tab.

lendingAndBonus.label: Lending Bonus & Rewards
lendingAndBonus.caption: Related to This Lending Strategy Only

lockedInfo.label: Total KSU Locked
lockedInfo.tooltip: Your amount of KSU currently locked.

apyBonus.label: APY Bonus
apyBonus.tooltip: Your APY bonus (paid in KSU) in addition to the APY associated with your current USDC lending balances, which is only applicable to Loyalty Level 1 and 2 KSU Token Lockers. Loyalty Level 2 Token Lockers receive a higher APY bonus than Loyalty Level 1. The APY bonus is variable and will change from time to time to meet liquidity demand and supply requirements.

totalBonusYield.label: Total Bonus Interest Earnings
totalBonusYield.tooltip: Your current bonus interest earnings balance (paid in KSU) in addition to the interest earnings associated with your USDC lending in this Lending Strategy, whilst you have an active balance in this Lending Strategy. For example, if you withdraw your total lending from this Lending Strategy (and are therefore no longer active in this Lending Strategy), then your total bonus interest earnings will be reset to zero. To view a breakdown of your total historical bonus interest earnings across all Lending Strategies, please visit on the 'My Portfolio' tab.

lifeTimeBonus.label: Lifetime Bonus Interest Earnings
lifeTimeBonus.tooltip: The total amount of bonus interest earnings you have accumulated from this Lending Strategy since the very first time you achieved (and maintained) Loyalty Level 1 or 2.

allOtherRewards.label: View KSU Locking for all other rewards

transactionsHistory.title: Your Transactions
transactionsHistory.tooltip: The status of your lending requests and lending withdrawal requests to and from this Lending Strategy.

reallocated.label: Reallocated
reallocated.tooltip: Reallocated to the next available Tranche due to oversubscription of lending requests to the Tranche you originally requested. You can achieve priority access to loans by locking KSU to achieve/increase your Loyalty Level.

poolOverview.rksuBalanceToolTip: The value of your current rKSU balance, which is derived by a multiplier applied to your amount of locked KSU. This multiplier varies according to your locking period, per the below table. The value of your rKSU balance relative to your total current and pending USDC lending across all Lending Strategies determines your Loyalty Level. Your Loyalty Level determines the extent of your token utility (lending access priority and lending withdrawal priority to and from Lending Strategies) and associated rewards (APY bonus). Regardless of your Loyalty Level, your rKSU balance relative to the total rKSU in the Kasu ecosystem, also determines your share of Protocol Fees (noting you must participate in USDC lending to be eligible for Protocol Fee sharing).

senior.title: Senior Tranche APY
senior.tooltip: The Annual Percentage Yield currently offered by the Delegate for the Senior Tranche of this Lending Strategy, assuming all repayments will be made as expected. The Senior tranche offers the lowest APY (and therefore, the lowest risk) of all tranches, as it has the highest ranking repayment priority in the event of losses. In the event of losses, if any funds are recovered, Senior tranche Lenders are therefore repaid prior to Mezzanine and Junior tranche Lenders.

mezzanine.title: Mezzanine Tranche APY
mezzanine.tooltip: The Annual Percentage Yield currently offered by the Delegate for the Mezzanine Tranche of this Lending Strategy, assuming all repayments will be made as expected. The Mezzanine tranche offers a higher APY (and therefore, higher risk) than the Senior tranche, but a lower APY (and therefore, lower risk) than the Junior tranche. In the event of losses, the Mezzanine tranche has a higher ranking repayment priority than the Junior tranche, but lower than the Senior tranche. In the event of losses, if any funds are recovered, Mezzanine tranche Lenders are therefore repaid prior to Junior tranche Lenders, but after Senior tranche Lenders.

junior.title: Junior Tranche APY
junior.tooltip: The Annual Percentage Yield currently offered by the Delegate for the Junior Tranche of this Lending Strategy, assuming all repayments will be made as expected. The Junior tranche offers the highest APY (and therefore, the highest risk) of all tranches, as it has the lowest ranking repayment priority in the event of losses. In the event of losses, if any funds are recovered, Junior tranche Lenders are therefore repaid after Senior and Mezzanine tranche Lenders. In the absence of a Mezzanine tranche, Junior tranche Lenders simply rank behind Senior Tranche Lenders.

withdraw.title: Withdraw Request
withdraw.subtitle: Total Withdrawal Request Amount
withdraw.withdrawalSchedule: Withdrawal will be scheduled for the end of the current Epoch. The final Withdrawal Amount may vary due to Pool conditions.

amountInput.label: Withdraw Request Amount
amountInput.tooltip: The USDC lending amount you would like to request for withdrawal from this Lending Strategy.

totalInvestment.label: Total Lending Balance
totalInvestment.tooltip: Your current USDC lending balance in this Lending Strategy.

trancheInvestment.label: Tranche Lending Balance
trancheInvestment.tooltip: Your current USDC lending balance in this loan Tranche related of this Lending Strategy.

tranche.label: Tranche
tranche.tooltip: The loan Tranche related to this Lending Strategy that you request to make a withdrawal from.

confirmStep.amountLabel: to be withdrawn in the next Epoch
confirmStep.depositedLabel: to be deposited to the wallet address

errors.invalidCriteria: The value entered does not meet the criteria required for this field.
errors.tooManyDecimals: Enter a value with a maximum of 6 decimals.

senior.title: Senior Tranche
senior.tooltip: The current Annual Percentage Interest offered by the Delegate for the Senior Tranche within this Lending Strategy, assuming all repayments will be made as expected.

mezzanine.title: Mezzanine Tranche
mezzanine.tooltip: The current Annual Percentage Interest offered by the Delegate for the Mezzanine Tranche within this Lending Strategy, assuming all repayments will be made as expected.

junior.title: Junior Tranche
junior.tooltip: The current Annual Percentage Interest offered by the Delegate for the Junior Tranche within this Lending Strategy, assuming all repayments will be made as expected.

history.label: Lending History
history.tooltip: ​The total length of time the Delegate has been operating as a lending business.​

totalFunds.label: Total Loan Funds Originated
totalFunds.tooltip: Cumulative total USDC equivalent face value of all current and historical loans originated by the Delegate to end borrowers for this particular lending asset class, regardless of whether the loans have been made available on Kasu or not.​

totalLoans.label: Total Loans Originated
totalLoans.tooltip: Cumulative total number of all current and historical loans originated by the Delegate to end borrowers, regardless of whether the loans were made available on Kasu or not.

assetClass.label: Asset Class(es)
assetClass.tooltip: All lending specialisations, types or categories in which the Delegate has a track record of expertise, regardless of the Lending Strategies the Delegate has made available on Kasu.

otherPools.label: Other KASU Lending Strategies
otherPools.tooltip: ​Other Lending Strategies that the Delegate has made available on Kasu.​

loans.label: Total Active Lending
loans.tooltip: Total USDC equivalent face value of all loans that the Delegate currently has deployed to end borrowers, regardless of whether the loans have been made available on Kasu or not.

loss.label: Historical Loss Rate
loss.tooltip: Total unrecoverable losses expressed percentage of total loans originated by the Delegate since its inception, regardless of whether they relate to Lending Strategies made available on Kasu or not.

totalLossRate.label: Total Loss Rate
totalLossRate.tooltip: Total unrecoverable losses expressed as a percentage of total loans associated with the Delegate's history with this particular lending asset class, regardless of whether the loans have been made available on Kasu or not.​

apy.label: APY
apy.tooltip: The Annual Percentage Yield currently offered by the Delegate for this loan Tranche (in the case that there are multiple loan Tranches within this Lending Strategy). In the absence of multiple loan Tranches, then this reflects the APY offered for the entire Lending Strategy. This assumes all repayments will be made as expected.

assetClass.label: Asset Class
assetClass.tooltip: The lending specialisation, type or category adopted by the Delegate for this Lending Strategy.

exposureIndustry.label: Industry Exposure
exposureIndustry.tooltip: ​Industry and/or business category in which the Delegate's customers (end borrowers) operate.​

structureApy.label: Lending Strategy APY Structure
structureApy.tooltip: Indicates whether the APY offered by the Delegate is fixed for a specified period of time, or variable (subject to change upon each epoch).

term.label: Lending Strategy Loan Term
term.tooltip: The duration of the Lending Strategy. 'Open Ended' has no fixed term or duration and is considered ongoing. A fixed term or duration has an end date, at which time it is intended that the Lending Strategy will reach maturity and all Lenders will be fully repaid (assumes all repayments will be made as expected).

loan.label: Loan Structure (End Borrowers)
loan.tooltip: The structure of each loan provided by the Delegate to its customers (end borrowers) with regard to maturity date and repayment profile to suit the lending asset class related to this Lending Strategy. A Revolving Loan refers to a loan structure that has no defined end date as it is typically utilised to fund ongoing operations (akin to a Line of Credit, Working Capital Loan or Evergreen Facility). An Amortising Term Loan refers to a loan structure that has defined Principal and Interest repayment periods until it is fully repaid upon a specific end/maturity date, as it is typically utilised to fund core debt, capital expenditure and long term projects. An Interest Only Term Loan refers to a loan structure that has no principal repayments until a specific end/maturity date, as it is typically utilised to fund projects that have a defined exit period, at which time, the loan is fully repaid with the exit proceeds (or progressively repaid in line with asset sales, such as a residential apartment development).

valueLocked.label: Total Value Locked (TVL)
valueLocked.tooltip: Total USDC funds deployed by Lenders to this Lending Strategy, plus first loss capital (if contributed by the Delegate).

management.label: Total Active Lending
management.tooltip: Total USDC equivalent face value of all loans that the Delegate currently has deployed to end borrowers from this Lending Strategy.

yield.label: Interest Earned
yield.tooltip: Cumulative total gross interest earned by Lenders from this Lending Strategy since its inception on the Kasu protocol.

activeLoans.label: Active Loans
activeLoans.tooltip: The total number of all current (active) loans originated by the Delegate within this Lending Strategy to end borrowers.

capacity.label: Remaining Capacity
capacity.tooltip: Amount of additional USDC the Delegate is able to accept for this Lending Strategy, also represented as a percentage of the maximum Lending Strategy target USDC amount.​

firstLoss.label: First Loss Capital
firstLoss.tooltip: The amount of capital contributed by the Delegate that will be absorbed first in the event of any losses, prior to losses being absorbed by Lenders, thereby providing a degree of loss protection to Lenders.​ First Loss Capital cannot be deployed into loans.

lossRate.label: Lending Strategy Loss Rate
lossRate.tooltip: Total unrecoverable losses expressed as a percentage of total loans associated with this Lending Strategy.

guarantees.label: Guarantees
guarantees.tooltip: A legal undertaking over a Company, Trust or Director placing liability upon that particular party to repay the loan provided by the Delegate to its customer (end borrower) in the case that it cannot repay its debt.

chargeAssets.label: Charge over Business Assets
chargeAssets.tooltip: A legal security interest held by the Delegate over the assets of its customers (end borrowers), providing the Delegate with the right to enforce its interest over those assets in the event of default or insolvency.

bankControl.label: Control over Bank Accounts
bankControl.tooltip: Whether the Delegate has control over any of its customers' (end borrowers) bank accounts which derive cash revenues, providing the immediate right to these cash revenues to repay loans prior to the customer (end borrower) having access to these funds.

yearsBusiness.label: Minimum 3 years in Business
yearsBusiness.tooltip: A condition which requires a Delegate's customers (end borrowers) to prove that it has been operating for at least 3 years with adequate financial reporting history.

propertyOwners.label: Director(s)/Beneficial Owner(s) must be property owners
propertyOwners.tooltip: A condition enforced by the Delegate which requires at least one Director (or beneficial owner) every customer (end borrower) to be a property owner with sufficient equity. The purpose of this condition is to confirm a minimum level of wealth in order to provide comfort in the event that a Director (or beneficial owner) may become personally liable for its business loan(s) where recovery action may be required.

repayments.title: Repayments and Funds Flow
repayments.loanModelDescription: The Delegate's lending model is to facilitate Fiat currency loans to real world businesses off-chain. The Asset Class and Loan Structure outlined in the 'Lending Strategy Details' screen indicates that these loans are 'Revolving/Evergreen' Loan Facilities, with fluctuating loan balances, being a function of ongoing and simultaneous loan repayments and loan redraws in Fiat currency off-chain. Accordingly, these Fiat currency transactions can only be viewed via CSV download at this current point in time.
repayments.borrowerFundsCSV: Download CSV to view fiat currency funds flow on a per borrower basis:

aggregated.title: Aggregated Funds Flow
aggregated.description: An aggregated view of this funds flow for all end borrowers, along with other/related loan funds flow is as follows. Note, this is update upon the commencement of every Epoch (clearing period).

totalBorrowers.label: Total End Borrowers (Current)
totalBorrowers.tooltip: The number of individual businesses that the Delegate is currently lending to.

closingLoans.label: Closing Loans Balance
closingLoans.tooltip: Total combined USD equivalent loan balance of all loan Tranches within this Lending Strategy, representing funds deployed into loans to end borrowers (outstanding loans) upon the closure of the most recent epoch. The closing loans balance is the net effect of the below funds flows and related transactions and will be updated every epoch.

openingLoans.label: Opening Loans Balance
openingLoans.tooltip: Total USD equivalent loan balance of all loan Tranches within this Lending Strategy, representing funds deployed into loans to end borrowers (outstanding loans) upon the closure of the prior epoch, being the same as the start of the current epoch.

loansDrawn.label: Loans Drawn
loansDrawn.tooltip: The USD equivalent amount within this Lending Strategy of all additional loans drawn (deployed) to end borrowers during the most recent epoch (upon closure of the most recent epoch).

interestAccrued.label: Interest Accrued
interestAccrued.tooltip: The USD equivalent amount within this Lending Strategy of total interest accrued by end borrowers during the most recent epoch (upon closure of the most recent epoch).

interestPayments.label: Interest Payments
interestPayments.tooltip: The USD equivalent amount within this Lending Strategy of total actual interest paid by end borrowers during the most recent epoch (upon closure of the most recent epoch).

principalRepayments.label: Principal Repayments
principalRepayments.tooltip: The USD equivalent amount within this Lending Strategy of total loan principal repayments made by end borrowers during the most recent epoch (upon closure of the most recent epoch).

unrealisedLosses.label: Unrealised Losses
unrealisedLosses.tooltip: The USD equivalent amount of loans within this Lending Strategy that became subject to formal recovery or legal action during the most recent epoch (upon closure of the most recent epoch).

netInflows.label: Net Inflows/(Outflows)
netInflows.tooltip: The upcoming/expected USD equivalent net effect of the below funds flows for the current epoch (expected upon closure of the current epoch).

netDeposit.label: Net Lending/(Lending Withdrawals)
netDeposit.tooltip: The total, cumulative net effect of USDC lending settled and lending withdrawals settled to and from this Lending Strategy since its inception, upon the closure of the most recent epoch.

cumulativeDeposit.label: Cumulative Lending
cumulativeDeposit.tooltip: Total, cumulative USDC lending settled to this Lending Strategy since its inception, upon the closure of the most recent epoch.

cumulativeWithdraw.label: Cumulative Lending Withdrawals
cumulativeWithdraw.tooltip: Total, cumulative USDC lending withdrawals settled from this Lending Strategy since its inception, upon the closure of the most recent epoch.

netDeposits.label: Net Lending/(Withdrawal Requests)
netDeposits.tooltip: The net effect of all current USDC lending requests and lending withdrawal requests that remain queued for this Lending Strategy for the current epoch.

currentDeposits.label: Current Lending Requests
currentDeposits.tooltip: Total of all current USDC lending requests that remain queued for this Lending Strategy for the current epoch.

currentWithdrawal.label: Current Lending Withdrawal Requests
currentWithdrawal.tooltip: Total of all current USDC lending withdrawal requests that remain queued for this Lending Strategy for the current epoch.

summary.metric-1-tooltip: Total Combined USDC funds deployed by Lenders across all Lending Strategies, plus the current value of all KSU locked in the Kasu protocol.
summary.metric-2-tooltip: Combined USDC equivalent face value of all loans across all Lending Strategies on Kasu that Delegates currently have deployed to end borrowers.
summary.metric-3-tooltip: Cumulative total USDC equivalent face value of all current and historical loans originated by Delegates to end borrowers from all Lending Strategies on Kasu.
summary.metric-4-tooltip: Cumulative total gross interest earned by Lenders from all loans since the inception of the Kasu protocol.
summary.metric-5-tooltip: Total unrecoverable losses expressed as a percentage of total loans associated with all Lending Strategies on the Kasu protocol.

totalKsuLocked.title: Total KSU Locked
totalKsuLocked.tooltip: Your balance of KSU currently locked.

lendingPoolInvestment.title: Total Lending Balance
lendingPoolInvestment.tooltip: Total amount of USDC lending you currently have deployed across all loans.

weightedApy.title: Weighted Average APY
weightedApy.tooltip: The average APY you are currently earning across all loans, adjusted to reflect your weighted contribution to each individual loan relative to your total contribution across all loans.

yieldEarnings.title: Interest Earnings
yieldEarnings.tooltip: The total amount of interest you have earned since the beginning of your lending activities on Kasu.

ksuBonusRewards.title: KSU Bonus & Rewards
ksuBonusRewards.tooltip: The total amount of KSU earned (and estimated USDC equivalent value) since you very first locked KSU associated with: 1) APY Bonus (only applicable to Loyalty Level 1 and 2 KSU Token Lockers); and, 2) KSU Launch Bonus (only applicable for early Token Lockers until the KSU bonus pool (5% of total supply) is fully consumed, which is based on the amount and duration of KSU locked and the associated multiplier).

protocolFeesEarned.title: Protocol Fees Earned
protocolFeesEarned.tooltip: Your share of USDC Protocol Fees earned (claimed and unclaimed) since you very first locked KSU and participated in USDC lending on Kasu. A Token Locker must also participate in USDC lending and generate rKSU to be eligible for Protocol Fee Sharing. Token Lockers, who are also Lenders generating rKSU, are entitled to a share of 5% of the total gross interest earnings generated by lending activities on Kasu. Your proportionate share of this amount is determined by your rKSU balance relative to the total combined rKSU balance of all Lenders in the Kasu ecosystem. For example, in a scenario where a total of 1,000 rKSU from Lenders exists in the entire Kasu ecosystem, a Lender with a current balance of 150 rKSU (which is 15%) would be entitled to 15% of all Protocol Fees. This proportionality is augmented as more Lenders lock (or unlock) KSU to generate more rKSU (or burn more rKSU when unlocking), entitling them to a proportionate share of Protocol Fees.

wallet.title: My Wallet
wallet.metric-1-tooltip: The individual balances of all your cryptocurrencies in your connected Web3 wallet that can be instantly converted to KSU.
wallet.metric-2-tooltip: Your current KSU balance (and estimated USDC equivalent value) held in your Web3 wallet.
wallet.metric-3-toolip: Total USDC equivalent value of all tokens in your Web3 wallet that can be used to purchase KSU tokens.
